greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Sum_{j>=1} (2*j - 1)^k*x^(2*j-1)/(1 - x^(2*j-1)).
comment: A(n,k) is the sum of k-th powers of odd divisors of n.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Odd Divisor Function
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[Sum[(2 i - 1)^k x^(2 i - 1)/(1 - x^(2 i - 1)), {i, 1, n}], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 12}, {n, 1, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 14 2017
